question: Which country has extended a line of credit of USD 1-billion to Central Asian countries?
explanation:
India has recently extended a line of credit of $1-billion to Central Asian countries. This financial assistance would be used for priority projects in connectivity, energy, IT and health care.
This is a part of Indiaâ€™s efforts to boost its role as a transparent development partner. Also, India offered grant assistance for high impact community development projects to boost socio-economic development in Central Asia.
